problem_text: Figure shows an overhead view of two particles moving at constant momentum along horizontal paths. Particle 1, with momentum magnitude $p_1=5.0 \mathrm{~kg} \cdot \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}$, has position vector $\vec{r}_1$ and will pass $2.0 \mathrm{~m}$ from point $O$. Particle 2 , with momentum magnitude $p_2=2.0 \mathrm{~kg} \cdot \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}$, has position vector $\vec{r}_2$ and will pass $4.0 \mathrm{~m}$ from point $O$. What is the magnitude of the net angular momentum $\vec{L}$ about point $O$ of the two-particle system?
